channel.title: The Possibility Podcast with Dr. Ann Vertel
channel.description:
Dr. Ann Vertel is a success psychologist and entrepreneur mindset expert who will open you up to what’s possible so you can stop wondering if there’s “something more,” and get out there and conquer the world!
If you’ve always thought you’d like to create something new, or become an entrepreneur, or write a book, or establish a foundation, or bike across country, or change careers, or start a business, or chase a childhood dream, or try something that just doesn’t seem to “fit in,” this is the show for you.
Ann’s special guests share how they discovered what they wanted to be “when they grew up,” followed their dream, left unfulfilling jobs, embraced their passion, blazed new trails, turned pro, made mistakes, took big risks, and overcame fear. But fair warning, Ann might just rekindle that childhood dream of yours or awaken you to a whole new set of possibilities, and then you’ll have to get ready for greatness :-)
It’s time to embrace who you truly are so you can fulfill your highest potential. Be encouraged, feel inspired, and know you are not alone in this zany quest for something that lights you up!
channel.itunes:summary:
Dr. Ann Vertel is a success psychologist and entrepreneur mindset expert who will open you up to what's possible so you can stop wondering if there’s “something more,” and get out there and conquer the world!
If you've always thought you'd like to create something new, or become an entrepreneur, or write a book, or establish a foundation, or bike across country, or change careers, or start a business, or chase a childhood dream, or try something that just doesn't seem to "fit in," this is the show for you.
Ann’s special guests share how they discovered what they wanted to be “when they grew up,” followed their dream, left unfulfilling jobs, embraced their passion, blazed new trails, turned pro, made mistakes, took big risks, and overcame fear. But fair warning, Ann might just rekindle that childhood dream of yours or awaken you to a whole new set of possibilities, and then you’ll have to get ready for greatness :-)
It's time to embrace who you truly are so you can fulfill your highest potential. Be encouraged, feel inspired, and know you are not alone in this zany quest for something that lights you up!
Questions or comments? http://PossibilityPodcast.com (AnnVertel.com/possibilitypodcast/)
channel.itunes:author: Ann Vertel, Ph.D.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Become an Entrepreneur - Find Your Passion - Start a Business - Follow Your Dream - Change Careers - Create - Innovate - Discover the Possibilities
channel.itunes:keywords: entrepreneurs, entrepreneurship, women entrepreneurs, possibility, motivation, success, career, mindset, starting a business, creativity, inspiration, innovation, personal development

item.title: 17: Raising Your Energy Level [Podcast]
item.dc:creator: Ann Vertel
item.description: You can maximize your energy throughout the day when you enhance your energy sources based on your temperament. Aside from the normal things everyone should be doing for their physical energy, such as sleeping enough, eating right, and working out, there are some other things you can do to maximize your mental or psychological energy. Click […]
item.content:encoded:
You can maximize your energy throughout the day when you enhance your energy sources based on your temperament.

Aside from the normal things everyone should be doing for their physical energy, such as sleeping enough, eating right, and working out, there are some other things you can do to maximize your mental or psychological energy.

Click to Listen

In this episode, I give you a 10-question quiz to help you determine whether your greatest source of mental energy is internal or external – knowing this is crucial to expanding your opportunities for more energy.

I also share with you some of the specific strategies both introverts and extroverts can do to increase their ability to focus and be more productive throughout the day.

Announcements

  • If you enjoyed this podcast episode, I would be honored if you would subscribe and leave an honest rating/review in iTunes so others can find the podcast too! Thank you

Aside from the normal things everyone should be doing for their physical energy, such as sleeping enough, eating right, and working out, there are some other things you can do to maximize your mental or psychological energy.
In this episode, I give you a 10-question quiz to help you determine whether your greatest source of mental energy is internal or external - knowing this is crucial to expanding your opportunities for more energy.

item.title: 16: Reach Higher with LeeAnne Ruff [Podcast]
item.dc:creator: Ann Vertel
item.description: Reaching higher is LeeAnne Ruff’s approach to life, business, faith, and family. You’ll be inspired by her passion for leading others to their greatest success though leadership, self-respect, trust, determination, and an unflinching belief in service to others. LeeAnne lead a dynamically successful direct sales team for over twenty years and now finds tremendous fulfillment […]
item.content:encoded:
Reaching higher is LeeAnne Ruff’s approach to life, business, faith, and family.

You’ll be inspired by her passion for leading others to their greatest success though leadership, self-respect, trust, determination, and an unflinching belief in service to others.

LeeAnne lead a dynamically successful direct sales team for over twenty years and now finds tremendous fulfillment in helping others lead teams of their own.

Her parenting tips along, having raised four remarkably successful children, will help any parent lead their kids with love.

Click to Listen

item.title: 15: Click it up a Notch with Courtney Slazinik [Podcast]
item.dc:creator: Ann Vertel
item.description: It took a broken camera at a critical moment to launch Courtney into a thriving business teaching others how to take photographs of a lifetime. Courtney both mentions and embodies Farrah Gray’s sentiment: “Build your own dreams or someone will hire you to build theirs.” She shares some great insight on what is possible for those […]
item.content:encoded:
It took a broken camera at a critical moment to launch Courtney into a thriving business teaching others how to take photographs of a lifetime.

Courtney both mentions and embodies Farrah Gray’s sentiment: “Build your own dreams or someone will hire you to build theirs.” She shares some great insight on what is possible for those wanting to build a business around their love of photography, or any other passion – especially military wives and other people with portable lives.

Courtney can also inspire you to improve your photography skills and capture your child’s life with her idea-generating 30-day photography challenge, “The Unexpected Everyday.”

Click to Listen

Announcements

  • Thanks to everyone who left a review of The Possibility Podcast in iTunes
  • The Possibility Podcast is also available on Stitcher Radio, on Zune, and on XBox.

item.title: 14: Producing Movies with Jenifer Madson [Podcast]
item.dc:creator: Ann Vertel
item.description: An award-winning author and executive coach, Jenifer’s mission to Impact First has created a Facebook following of over 45,000 and the opportunity to produce an indie film. Her 27-year recovery from addiction led her to form Impact First, providing grants, business coaching, and marketing support to filmmakers who are putting their special talents to use […]
item.content:encoded:
An award-winning author and executive coach, Jenifer’s mission to Impact First has created a Facebook following of over 45,000 and the opportunity to produce an indie film.

Her 27-year recovery from addiction led her to form Impact First, providing grants, business coaching, and marketing support to filmmakers who are putting their special talents to use for social good.

Jenifer’s first film,  Ballon: The Movie, follows a professional ballerina caught in the cycle of all night partying and cocaine-fueled rehearsals who must confront her drug addiction when she crumbles during an important audition.

Click to Listen

Announcements

  • Thanks to everyone who left a review of The Possibility Podcast in iTunes

item.title: 12: How to Overcome Writer’s Block [Podcast]
item.dc:creator: Ann Vertel
item.description: What if overcoming writer’s block was as simple as shifting your focus? If you are writing what you think other people want you to write, or to delight them, or impress them, you are not being authentic and your writing will suffer (or grind to a halt!) Let me share three simple mindset shifts to […]
item.content:encoded:
What if overcoming writer’s block was as simple as shifting your focus?

Break Writer’s Block!

If you are writing what you think other people want you to write, or to delight them, or impress them, you are not being authentic and your writing will suffer (or grind to a halt!)

Let me share three simple mindset shifts to help you break down your writer’s block. Let’s move you out of paralysis so you can start enjoying your writing more than ever before!

Click to Listen

Announcements

  • Thanks to everyone who left a review of The Possibility Podcast in iTunes
  • The Possibility Podcast is also available on Stitcher Radio, on Zune, and on XBox.

Episode Resources & Links

item.itunes:keywords: entrepreneurs, women entrepreneurs, entrepreneurship, online business
item.itunes:subtitle: The Mindset to Break Writer's Block - Finding Your Authentic Voice
item.itunes:summary:
What if overcoming writer's block was as simple as shifting your focus?
If you are writing what others expect or to delight or to impress, you are not being authentic and your writing will suffer (or grind to a halt!)
These three keys to not having writer's block will help you move out of paralysis and start enjoying your writing more than ever before.
Episode info and comments at http://AnnVertel.com/12/

item.title: 11: How to be a Best Selling Author with Tara Meyer-Robson [Podcast]
item.dc:creator: Ann Vertel
item.description: Exhausted and frustrated with traditional methods, Tara pioneered a step-by-step system to get her book moving up the best-seller list. Tara Meyer-Robson is authentic and transparent as she shares the success she had marketing her book with an online campaign. She documented every step and turned it into her signature “Best Seller in 1 Day” […]
item.content:encoded:
Exhausted and frustrated with traditional methods, Tara pioneered a step-by-step system to get her book moving up the best-seller list.

Tara Meyer-Robson is authentic and transparent as she shares the success she had marketing her book with an online campaign. She documented every step and turned it into her signature “Best Seller in 1 Day” program. Hear some of her best tips for what is possible and how you too can become a best selling author!

Click to Listen

Announcements

item.itunes:summary:
Exhausted and frustrated with traditional methods, Tara Meyer-Robson pioneered a step-by-step system to get her book moving up the best-seller list and shares some innovative strategies in this interview. Hear about the challenges she overcame and the ultimate success she had marketing her book with an online book tour and campaign. She documented every step and turned it into her signature "Best Seller in 1 Day" program. Hear some of her best tips for becoming a best selling author! item.title: 10: How to Overcome Fear in 6 Easy Steps [Podcast]
item.dc:creator: Ann Vertel
item.description: Is your normal reaction to fear fight or flight? How about freeze or stall? You can change it to ACTION in 6 easy steps… Each time we act through our fear we expand our capacity to handle it. Successful people know fear is normal and can even be energizing. To move forward, you must dissipate […]
item.content:encoded:
Is your normal reaction to fear fight or flight? How about freeze or stall? You can change it to ACTION in 6 easy steps…

Each time we act through our fear we expand our capacity to handle it. Successful people know fear is normal and can even be energizing.

To move forward, you must dissipate the fear as soon as you feel it. This episode gives you the step-by-step process to do that for every new challenge you face!

Click to Listen

item.title: 09: Beachbody Coach Ashley Mahaffey Builds Women Champions [Podcast]
item.dc:creator: Ann Vertel
item.description: Ashley Mahaffey is a wife, mom, and 2-time Ironman Triathlon Finisher. Ashley knows encouragement is a much better motivator than tearing ourselves down. When we focus on what we’re doing well instead of berating ourselves for what we haven’t achieved yet, we can make huge strides in our health, nutrition, fitness, business, and happiness. She […]
item.content:encoded:
Ashley Mahaffey is a wife, mom, and 2-time Ironman Triathlon Finisher.

Ashley knows encouragement is a much better motivator than tearing ourselves down. When we focus on what we’re doing well instead of berating ourselves for what we haven’t achieved yet, we can make huge strides in our health, nutrition, fitness, business, and happiness. She wants her clients and Beachbody coaches to love themselves and is fond of saying, “love never gives up.” Be inspired by Ashley and her approach to love and health!

Click to Listen

item.title: 07: Reclaim Your Health and Rock Your Radiance with Casey Sollock [Podcast]
item.dc:creator: Ann Vertel
item.description: A few years ago I was exhausted, stressed, and felt like I was just fading away. I’m pretty sure my adrenal glands were shot and no matter how much I slept or exercised, I just couldn’t seem to get my energy back. Then in walked Casey Sollock and her life-saving green smoothies. A few months […]
item.content:encoded:
A few years ago I was exhausted, stressed, and felt like I was just fading away.

I’m pretty sure my adrenal glands were shot and no matter how much I slept or exercised, I just couldn’t seem to get my energy back.

Then in walked Casey Sollock and her life-saving green smoothies. A few months later, I bought a Vitamix and there isn’t a single day it isn’t whipping up a carafe full of goodness.

You’ll enjoy Casey’s story about how she got healthy and how she turned that into a thriving online business (and how you could too!)

Click to Listen

Announcements

  • Thanks to everyone who left a review of The Possibility Podcast in iTunes
  • The Possibility Podcast is also available on Stitcher Radio, on Zune, and on XBox.

item.title: 06: Stop Procrastinating with the 5-Step Process to Build Self-Confidence [Podcast]
item.dc:creator: Ann Vertel
item.description: Shorten the procrastination cycle and move forward confidently by following this 5-step process for building self-confidence. Click to Listen Anyone preparing to take on something big and scary and new will usually be hit with an overwhelming sense of paralysis. This shows up as procrastination, sickness, busyness. Doubt sets in. We seek more advice, information, […]
item.content:encoded:
Shorten the procrastination cycle and move forward confidently by following this 5-step process for building self-confidence.

Click to Listen

Anyone preparing to take on something big and scary and new will usually be hit with an overwhelming sense of paralysis. This shows up as procrastination, sickness, busyness. Doubt sets in. We seek more advice, information, or confirmation.

On this show I share how to recognize the 4 low self-confidence traps, take back your power, trust yourself, foster momentum, and expect to win!

Announcements

  • Thanks to everyone who left an honest rating and review of The Possibility Podcast in iTunes - you ROCK! This helps other people find the show and for that, I am truly grateful.

Episode Resources & Links

  • More Possibility Podcast Episodes

What To Do Now

  • If you enjoyed this podcast episode, I would be honored if you would subscribe and leave an honest rating/review in iTunes so others can find the podcast too! Thank you
item.itunes:keywords: stop procrastinating, procrastination, confidence, build confidence, self-confidence, build self-confidence
item.itunes:subtitle: A Simple 5-Step Process to Build Self-Confidence
item.itunes:summary:
Anyone preparing to take on something big and scary and new will usually be hit with an overwhelming sense of paralysis. This shows up as procrastination, sickness, busyness. Doubt sets in. We seek more advice, information, or confirmation.
All creative people can shorten the procrastination cycle and move forward confidently by following this simple 5-Step process to build self-confidence.
Dr. Ann Vertel shows you how to recognize the 4 low self-confidence traps, take back your power, trust yourself, foster momentum, and expect to win!
Episode info and comments at http://AnnVertel.com/06/

item.title: 05: Jennifer Franks Shares How to Write and Finish Your Book in the Margins of Your Busy Life [Podcast]
item.dc:creator: Ann Vertel
item.category: Wild Card Willie and the Pony Express
item.description: As a child, Jennifer Franks lived in Nigeria, India, Venezuela, Malaysia, Thailand, Borneo, and Indonesia. Click to Listen After attending four different high schools, she earned a Health Science degree from Fresno State College in California, where she also began work on her first book. The Lotus Blossom brings to life the year she and […]
item.content:encoded:
As a child, Jennifer Franks lived in Nigeria, India, Venezuela, Malaysia, Thailand, Borneo, and Indonesia.

Click to Listen

After attending four different high schools, she earned a Health Science degree from Fresno State College in California, where she also began work on her first book. The Lotus Blossom brings to life the year she and her family lived in India, the only westerners in the village.

Jennifer wrote her second book, Wild Card Willie and the Pony Express for her children. By connecting history and the frontier, she created a work of historical fiction used in her town’s school curriculum that children can’t put down.

Jennifer’s most recent book, He Shall Be Peace: The Prophecy of the Child Jesus, compellingly brings the gospels to life.

Her goal as a writer is to author a book in every genre.

During the interview, Jennifer mentions Ernest Hemingway’s quote, “The hardest part of writing a book is finishing it.” You’ll love her ideas on how you too can write and finish your book in the margins of a busy life.

Announcements

  • Thanks to everyone who left a review of The Possibility Podcast in iTunes

Episode Resources & Links

  • Jennifer’s “He Shall Be Peace” Website
  • He Shall Be Peace: The Prophecy of the Child Jesus
  • The Lotus Blossom
  • Wild Card Willie and the Pony Express
  • Connect with Jennifer on Facebook
  • Scrivener writing software
  • More Possibility Podcast Episodes

What To Do Now

  • If you enjoyed this podcast episode, I would be honored if you would subscribe and leave an honest rating/review in iTunes so others can find the podcast too! Thank you

item.itunes:summary:
As a child, Jennifer Franks lived in Nigeria, India, Venezuela, Malaysia, Thailand, Borneo, and Indonesia. During this interview, Jennifer mentions Ernest Hemingway's quote, "The hardest part of writing a book is finishing it." You'll love her ideas on how you too can write and finish your book in the margins of a busy life.

item.title: 04: Love What You Do So Much You Never Want to Retire [Podcast]
item.dc:creator: Ann Vertel
item.description: What if you loved what you do so much you never wanted to quit? Feel more joy by learning this one important distinction. Click to Listen If we spend all day solving problems, the day feels full but we can feel empty. Finding even a little space in the margins of our lives to add […]
item.content:encoded:
What if you loved what you do so much you never wanted to quit? Feel more joy by learning this one important distinction.

Click to Listen

If we spend all day solving problems, the day feels full but we can feel empty. Finding even a little space in the margins of our lives to add something creative can absolutely bring you back to life and light you up!

Announcements

  • Thanks to everyone who left a review of The Possibility Podcast in iTunes

Episode Resources & Links

  • The Path of Least Resistance: Learning to Become the Creative Force in Your Own Life by Robert Fritz
  • More Possibility Podcast Episodes

Your Turn

Take just 15 minutes today and write out the outline for that screen play you keep talking about, or that idea for a casserole recipe that keeps rattling around in your head.

Pluck out a tune on your dusty piano or dig out that box of finger paints and sit at your kitchen counter and play.

Maybe you could draw out the floor plan for that cabin in the woods you’ve been dreaming about all these years.

What if you loved what you do so much you never wanted to quit?
Click To Tweet

Don’t let all that stuff that won’t matter in a hundred years rob you or the world of that gift hidden inside you just begging to be born.

Go make something. Then hit me up in the comments below and let me know how it felt :-)

What To Do Now

  • If you enjoyed this podcast episode, I would be honored if you would subscribe and leave a rating/review in iTunes so others can find the podcast too! Thank you
item.itunes:keywords: creativity, problem solving, path of least resistance, innovation, create something new, love your work, become an entrepreneur, write a screenplay, write a book
item.itunes:subtitle: Don’t let all that stuff that won’t matter in a hundred years rob you of that gift hidden inside you just begging to be born.
item.itunes:summary:
What if you loved what you do so much you never wanted to quit? How much of your day is spent solving problems? Problem solving can be draining, exhausting, and frustrating. Don’t let all that stuff that won’t matter in a hundred years rob you of that gift hidden inside you just begging to be born. It's time to create something - time to bring something into existence that simply wasn't there before.
Episode info and comments at http://AnnVertel.com/04/
Resources for all episodes at http://AnnVertel.com/possibilitypodcast/
item.itunes:author: Ann Vertel, Ph.D.

item.title: 03: Putting Life Back in Business with Mike Michalowicz [Podcast]
item.dc:creator: Ann Vertel
item.description: Mike Michalowicz was 24 when he started his first business, but not before moving his family into a retirement building! Click to Listen He’s bootstrapped several multi-million dollar businesses, wrote for The Wall Street Journal, and is the best selling author of The Toilet Paper Entrepreneur, The Pumpkin Plan, and Profit First. Now, as CEO of Provendus Group, Mike helps […]
item.content:encoded:
Mike Michalowicz was 24 when he started his first business, but not before moving his family into a retirement building!

Click to Listen

He’s bootstrapped several multi-million dollar businesses, wrote for The Wall Street Journal, and is the best selling author of The Toilet Paper Entrepreneur, The Pumpkin Plan, and Profit First.

Now, as CEO of Provendus Group, Mike helps ignite explosive growth in companies that have plateaued. He is also MSNBC’s business make-over expert and a keynote speaking on entrepreneurship.

I know you’ll enjoy his sense of humor and refreshing authenticity!

Episode Resources & Links

  • Mike Michalowicz (Hands down, one of the most uniquely designed and fun sites on the planet!)
  • Mike’s TEDx Talk
  • Provendus Group (Mike is CEO)
  • The Toilet Paper Entrepreneur: The Tell-it-like-it-is guide to cleaning up in business, even if you are at the end of your roll
  • The Pumpkin Plan: A Simple Strategy to Grow a Remarkable Business in Any Field
  • Profit First: A Simple System to Transform Your Business from a Cash-Eating Monster to a Money-Making Machine
  • Mike’s Fan Page
  • More Possibility Podcast Episodes

Your Turn

What was your biggest insight from the interview with Mike? Please leave me a comment below.
item.itunes:keywords: mike michalowicz, mike michaelowicz, mike michalowitz, provendus group, TEDx, TED talk, toilet paper entrepreneur, the pumpkin plan, profit first, entrepreneurship

item.itunes:summary:
Mike Michalowicz was 24 when he started his first business, but not before moving his family into a retirement building! Author of The Toilet Paper Entrepreneur, The Pumpkin Plan, and Profit First, Mike shares his rags to riches to rags back to riches story on his crazy journey to success.
Episode info and comments at http://AnnVertel.com/03/

item.itunes:author: Ann Vertel, Ph.D.

item.title: 01: Christian Women Entrepreneurs Flock to Diane Cunningham [Podcast]
item.dc:creator: Ann Vertel
item.category: national association of christian women entrepreneurs
item.description: Diane Cunningham is the Founder and CEO of the National Association of Christian Women Entrepreneurs and my special guest for this inaugural episode of the show. Diane is a speaker, a published author, and a plane crash survivor. You’ll enjoy her mission, her perspective on life, and her fascinating journey into entrepreneurship. Click to Listen […]
item.content:encoded:
Diane Cunningham is the Founder and CEO of the National Association of Christian Women Entrepreneurs and my special guest for this inaugural episode of the show.

Diane is a speaker, a published author, and a plane crash survivor. You’ll enjoy her mission, her perspective on life, and her fascinating journey into entrepreneurship.

Click to Listen

Episode Resources & Links

In this episode, I mentioned several resources you might enjoy:

  • National Association of Christian Women Entrepreneurs (NACWE)
  • More Possibility Podcast Episodes

Your Turn

What was your biggest insight from the interview with Diane? Please leave me a comment below
item.itunes:keywords: christian, women, entrepreneurs, ann vertel, diane cunningham, women entrepreneurs, entrepreneurship, christian women entrepreneurs, plane crash survivor
item.itunes:subtitle: See what’s possible in your life, stop wondering if there’s “something more,” and get out there and conquer the world!
item.itunes:summary:
Diane Cunningham, President and Founder of the National Association of Christian Women Entrepreneurs (NACWE) shares her remarkable journey into entrepreneurship, including surviving a plane crash.
Episode info and comments at http://AnnVertel.com/01/
